CatDescriptText: Mrs. E.W. Shand, of Roseborough Place, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 15, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Should a woman, who has passed the age of 45, marry for the first time?" answer reads: "It depends on whether or not they are congenial. If they are, it's all right."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Mrs. E.W. Shand, wearing light colored hat with feather, eyeglasses, light colored coat, and light colored gloves, holding handbag and box that reads "Joseph Horne Co. Pittsburgh", standing in front of marble with store windows that reads "Yamron Brothers Gifts" with display of lamps on right
